verses.kjv: Then Naomi her mother in law said unto her, My daughter, shall I not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee?
verses.web: Naomi her mother-in-law said to her, “My daughter, shall I not seek rest for you, that it may be well with you?
verses.ct: One day Naomi, Ruth's mother-in-law, said to her, "My daughter, shouldn't I find you a home where you'll be taken care of and provided for?

verses.kjv: And now is not Boaz of our kindred, with whose maidens thou wast? Behold, he winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.
verses.web: Now isn’t Boaz our kinsman, with whose maidens you were? Behold, he will be winnowing barley tonight on the threshing floor.
verses.ct: Now think about this — Boaz, the man whose young women you've been working alongside, is our relative. Tonight he'll be winnowing barley at the threshing floor.

verses.kjv: Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto the man, until he shall have done eating and drinking.
verses.web: Therefore wash yourself, anoint yourself, get dressed, and go down to the threshing floor; but don’t make yourself known to the man until he has finished eating and drinking.
verses.ct: So here's what I want you to do: wash up, put on some perfume, get dressed in your best clothes, and go down to the threshing floor. But don't let him know you're there until he's finished eating and drinking.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark the place where he shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncover his feet, and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do.
verses.web: It shall be, when he lies down, that you shall note the place where he is lying. Then you shall go in, uncover his feet, and lay down. Then he will tell you what to do.”
verses.ct: When he lies down, pay attention to where he settles. Then go over, uncover his feet, and lie down there. He'll tell you what to do next."

verses.kjv: And she said unto her, All that thou sayest unto me I will do.
verses.web: She said to her, “All that you say, I will do.”
verses.ct: Ruth replied, "I'll do everything you've told me."

verses.kjv: And she went down unto the floor, and did according to all that her mother in law bade her.
verses.web: She went down to the threshing floor, and did everything that her mother-in-law told her.
verses.ct: So she went down to the threshing floor and did exactly what her mother-in-law had instructed.

verses.kjv: And when Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softly, and uncovered his feet, and laid her down.
verses.web: When Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of grain. She came softly, uncovered his feet, and laid down.
verses.ct: Boaz ate and drank until he was in good spirits, then went to lie down at the far end of the grain pile. Ruth crept over quietly, uncovered his feet, and lay down.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at midnight, that the man was afraid, and turned himself: and, behold, a woman lay at his feet.
verses.web: At midnight, the man was startled and turned himself; and behold, a woman lay at his feet.
verses.ct: Around midnight, Boaz woke with a start and rolled over — and there was a woman lying at his feet.

verses.kjv: And he said, Who art thou? And she answered, I am Ruth thine handmaid: spread therefore thy skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art a near kinsman.
verses.web: He said, “Who are you?” She answered, “I am Ruth your servant. Therefore spread the corner of your garment over your servant; for you are a near kinsman.”
verses.ct: "Who are you?" he asked. She answered, "I am Ruth, your servant. Spread the corner of your garment over me, for you are my family's kinsman-redeemer."

verses.kjv: And he said, Blessed be thou of the LORD, my daughter: for thou hast shewed more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, inasmuch as thou followedst not young men, whether poor or rich.
verses.web: He said, “You are blessed by LORD, my daughter. You have shown more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning, because you didn’t follow young men, whether poor or rich.
verses.ct: Boaz said, "May the LORD bless you, my daughter. This act of loyalty is even greater than what you showed before — you didn't go chasing after younger men, whether poor or rich.

verses.kjv: And now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou requirest: for all the city of my people doth know that thou art a virtuous woman.
verses.web: Now, my daughter, don’t be afraid. I will do to you all that you say; for all the city of my people knows that you are a worthy woman.
verses.ct: So don't be afraid, my daughter. I'll do everything you've asked. Everyone in town knows you are a woman of noble character.

verses.kjv: And now it is true that I am thy near kinsman: howbeit there is a kinsman nearer than I.
verses.web: Now it is true that I am a near kinsman. However, there is a kinsman nearer than I.
verses.ct: Now it's true that I am one of your kinsman-redeemers. But there's another relative who is closer in line than I am.

verses.kjv: Tarry this night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will perform unto thee the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the kinsman’s part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee, then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee, as the LORD liveth: lie down until the morning.
verses.web: Stay this night, and in the morning, if he will perform for you the part of a kinsman, good. Let him do the kinsman’s duty. But if he will not do the duty of a kinsman for you, then I will do the duty of a kinsman for you, as LORD lives. Lie down until the morning.”
verses.ct: Stay here tonight. In the morning, if he's willing to fulfill the kinsman's duty for you, good — let him do it. But if he's not willing, then as surely as the LORD lives, I will do it myself. Now lie down until morning."

verses.kjv: And she lay at his feet until the morning: and she rose up before one could know another. And he said, Let it not be known that a woman came into the floor.
verses.web: She lay at his feet until the morning, then she rose up before one could discern another. For he said, “Let it not be known that the woman came to the threshing floor.”
verses.ct: She lay at his feet until morning, but got up before it was light enough for anyone to recognize her. Boaz said, "No one must know that a woman came to the threshing floor tonight."

verses.kjv: Also he said, Bring the vail that thou hast upon thee, and hold it. And when she held it, he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her: and she went into the city.
verses.web: He said, “Bring the mantle that is on you, and hold it.” She held it; and he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her; then he went into the city.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Hold out the shawl you're wearing and keep it open." When she did, he measured out 6 measures of barley and placed it on her. Then she headed back to the city.

verses.kjv: And when she came to her mother in law, she said, Who art thou, my daughter? And she told her all that the man had done to her.
verses.web: When she came to her mother-in-law, she said, “How did it go, my daughter?” She told her all that the man had done for her.
verses.ct: When Ruth arrived home, her mother-in-law asked, "How did it go, my daughter?" Ruth told her everything Boaz had done for her.

verses.kjv: And she said, These six measures of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.
verses.web: She said, “He gave me these six measures of barley; for he said, ‘Don’t go empty to your mother-in-law.’ ”
verses.ct: She added, "He gave me these 6 measures of barley and said, 'Don't go back to your mother-in-law empty-handed.'"

verses.kjv: Then said she, Sit still, my daughter, until thou know how the matter will fall: for the man will not be in rest, until he have finished the thing this day.
verses.web: Then she said, “Wait, my daughter, until you know what will happen; for the man will not rest until he has settled this today.”
verses.ct: Naomi said, "Now be patient, my daughter, and wait to see how this plays out. That man won't rest until he has settled this matter today."
